course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Project Management
course.description: This course covers basic principles and practices of business project management.  Special emphases are on project planning, scheduling, and control while addressing both the technical and the social aspects of managing business projects.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Very interesting and useful.
reviews.comment_content: This course covers the basics of project management, including topics such as project selection, project planning, risk management, project control and organisational issues. The content loosely follows the textbook structure, however I would say that the textbook isn't necessary unless you want to do extra practice problems when revising.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Li is extremely interesting and I really enjoyed his teaching style. He gives students plenty of opportunities to participate in class discussions (with the added incentive of participation cards which contribute to your grade), and he also includes plenty of real-life examples to fully illustrate the theory or concept that is being presented. He's also very approachable and if you have any questions about the course content or otherwise, he's extremely helpful in answering questions. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
The final grade is composed of:

— Labs, individual assignments, attendance (20%).
— Final Project (20%)
— Participation (10%)
— Final Exam (50%)

The grading is relatively fair, however as the final exam score and project score isn't provided, it's hard to judge what the grading is really like. The final exam isn't too tough and going through the lecture notes and doing the in-class exercises is a good way to prepare.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively decent, and the two assignments aren't difficult as long as you understand the class concepts and do the in-class exercises.

reviews.author: ehk118
reviews.comment_content:
Project Management Course (Project selection, project planning, risk management, project control and organizational issues)

Involve a few calculation problems (slack, lag time, network diagram)

The lab is about MS Project. Just need follow TA's instructions. It's easy to follow.

For the project, you can decide your own project, or choose the common project - Red Zuma Project.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very nice and his teaching is very organized and clear (but sometimes a bit boring)
He gave students quite a lot of opportunities to participate in class. He asked questions to lead us to think, so it's easier to understand the content.
Overall, very good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very very good grading!! Take this course if you are finding a good grade OM course~

— 5 Labs , 2 assignments (20%)
— Final Project (20%)
— Participation (10%)
— Final Exam (50%)

Full marks for labs and assignments. And participate in class (answer questions in class)
DON'T skip any lesson, since attendance is compulsory! Otherwise, mark will be deducted.

Unknown grading for final project and exam.

Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments, 5 labs, 1 project and 1 online final. Not heavy workload if you pay attention to class and lab.

reviews.author: abc1234567
reviews.comment_content:
Introducing the steps and procedures involved in managing different projects from start to the end. Also talked a bit on some advanced network diagrams (e.g. lag time, start to start relationship, finish to finish relationship etc). I think it's very interesting.
Also have 5 lab sessions to attend, make sure you wont skip the lab sessions though cuz u'll have to hand in assignment at the end (you'll get full marks if you have attended the session). MS project is quite a useful tool in project management.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very organized and clear.
Make sure you'll answer his questions from time to time cuz he got participation cards, but I only get 3 cards at the end, my grades is still fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade!
I didn't skip any of his lessons (he'll take attendance randomly), the 50% final isn't difficult (with cheat sheet). Attending all his lectures will be fine, I got an A for this course at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one group project, I'll chose the Red Zuma project from Textbook that requires you to use MS Project.Only took 2 afternoons to finish.
In total of 2 assignments for the whole semester and the questions aren't difficult as long as you didn't skip any classes (he'll go through similar questions with you in class and teach you how to do it step by step)

reviews.author: angelwaishan
reviews.comment_content: The course introduced project management in various aspects, points to note, concept like lag time and using software to better manage it. The software is very useful and I really learnt something in this course!
reviews.comment_teaching: I do enjoy Li, Qing's teaching style, very organized and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good. Attending lectures and joting some notes will do. As far as I remember, the tests are not very difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Not so sure about it as I took it last year. But it did not leave any bad impression in my mind, so should be fine :) Just remember there will be a project that you have to find a film to analyze how the people managed the project. Had a lot of fun!

reviews.author: jesslinv
reviews.comment_content: This course taught us concepts on project management, from the start to the finish of a project. There were 5 labs teaching us how to use the MS Project software which were quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very helpful and the teaching was very clear. He encouraged participation in class and was not boring at all.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was good. The project score will be given generously if you treat it seriously.
reviews.comment_workload: 2-3 assignments, 1 project and a final exam, not heavy compared to other courses. Assignments were easy and you can choose the topics for the project.

reviews.author: Wwl
reviews.title: Short review
reviews.comment_content: The course is quite useful and related to the reality.   It teaches you how to use MS Project which I think seldom used by actual companies since companies usually have their own PM tool or just use Excel.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes is boring but the content is useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade, I got A+.

2 assignments, 5labs
